quote: However, in recent years, the increasing availability of open and large data sources has opened up new opportunities for statistical analysis.
Modern machine learning models, tools and hardware can analyze vast amounts of data in real-time or near-real-time, providing more up-to-date and precise estimates of e.g. economic and social trends.
Machine learning is a subdiscipline of artificial intelligence that enables machines to learn from data and improve their performance over time without being explicitly programmed.
incorporating machine learning into official statistical production, one can benefit from the strengths of both approaches and make more informed decisions based on the most current and accurate data
Relying heavily on external data sources for machine learning in official statistics comes with significant risks.
If certain variables or factors are considered discriminatory or unethical, there may be a push towards eliminating or adjusting them to reduce algorithmic bias.
In the age of machine learning, you should always assume that derived data fields can be the result of a model prediction.
To mitigate these risks, data pipelines should be designed to monitor changes in incoming data frequency.

Monitoring everything that is relevant is another crucial step in mitigating the impact of changing data sources.
